content:
I, #{userName}, hereby pledge to touch something in nature on #{selected_days} starting from today until #{auto_destruct} between #{time_range}.

Each time, I will connect with the natural world by touching a leaf, a tree, a flower, a rock â€” anything that grew or formed outside the human-made world.

To prove my commitment, I will send a photo of myself touching it on the days Iâ€™ve committed. Also remember the object I touched was #{feature1} so I donâ€™t fake it. ðŸŒ¿ðŸ¤²

If I miss a day, I accept the consequences set in this quest.

This is my promise to myself â€” to stay rooted, stay present, and keep my connection with the Earth alive.

basicQuest.title: Touch Nature
basicQuest.instructions:
Nature is the original reset button. Touching something real â€” bark, soil, stone, petal â€” reminds you of whatâ€™s solid, alive, and not on a screen.

### ðŸŒ± What to Do:

* **Step outside** or go where nature lives.
* **Find something real.** A leaf. A rock. A tree. Even a patch of moss.
* **Touch it with care.** Stay present for just a few seconds. Let it ground you.
* **Notice what you feel.** Rough bark, soft petals, cool stone â€” nature speaks through sensation.

### âœ… End Goal:

> A quiet moment with the world beyond walls.
> Just you, your senses, and something ancient.

AiSnap.taskDescription: a person touching something in nature
